required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN), a Swiss-based foundation, implemented a complementary feeding project to improve dietary quality among children 6-59 months of age living in Ethiopia by improving demand and access to safe and nutritious foods, in particular eggs. Using a quasi-experimental design and two separate cross-sectional surveys at baseline and end-line, the evaluation seeks to determine the effects of the program on egg consumption, food diversity, availability of eggs, caregivers' behaviours toward eggs, caregivers' willingness to pay for eggs, and consumption of commercially available complementary foods.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN), a Swiss-based foundation, implemented a complementary feeding project to improve dietary quality among children 6-59 months of age living in Ethiopia by improving demand and access to safe and nutritious foods, in particular eggs. GAIN's complementary feeding project has four main components. Component one focuses on facilitating availability of nutritious food to targeted consumers (children 6-59 month) with the aim of improving suppliers' capacity to produce nutritious foods through formal and on the job trainings as well as facilitating enabling environment for the distribution of the products. Component two of the project involves distribution channels identification to strengthen or activate Kiosks to increase availability of nutritious food especially eggs. Component three, the demand creation component, seeks to stimulate demand among caregivers of children 6-59 months of age for nutritious food for their children. Finally, component four, the enabling environment component, seeks to strengthen the enabling environment for sustainable production and distribution of nutritious food for children as one of the solutions to improve nutrition.
Using a quasi-experimental design and two separate cross-sectional surveys at baseline and end-line, the evaluation seeks to determine the effects of the program on egg consumption, food diversity, availability of eggs, caregivers' behaviours toward eggs, caregivers' willingness to pay for eggs, and consumption of commercially available complementary foods.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cross-sectional pre- post-evaluation of intervention and comparison group
study_design_info.masking_description: Data collectors were masked to the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the number of eggs consumed from baseline to end-line
primary_outcome.description: Change in the average number of eggs consumed in the past 7 days by children 6 to 59 months of age from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the consumption of eggs from baseline to end-line
primary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of children 6-59 months of age consuming eggs in the last 7 days and in the last 24 hours from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

primary_outcome.measure: Change in food diversity from baseline to end-line
primary_outcome.description: Change in the number of six food groups (excluding eggs) consumed in the past 24 hours by children 6-59 months from baseline-to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in flesh food consumption from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of children 6-59 months of age consuming flesh foods in the last 24 hours from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in dairy consumption from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of children 6-59 months of age consuming dairy in the last 24 hours from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in household egg production from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of households producing eggs from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in egg purchasing from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of households that purchased egg in the last month from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in caregivers' (of children 6-59 months) behavioral determinants in the context of feeding eggs to children from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the mean factor score created from Likert scales of attitudes (attitudes scale, higher score reflects better attitudes towards eggs), norms (norms scale, higher score reflects better norms towards eggs), self-efficacy (self-efficacy scale, higher score reflects better self-efficacy), and intention towards eggs (intent to feed eggs to child, higher score reflects more intent to feed eggs) from baseline to end-line between the two study arms; change will be examined for a meta factor score combining all scales and each scale separately. Values of factor scores are unbounded and can be positive or negative.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in caregivers' willingness to pay for eggs from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in willingness to pay for eggs, using for example the change in mean maximum price that caregivers would be willing to pay for eggs from baseline to endline between the two study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Faffa consumption from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of children 6-59 months of age ever consuming Faffa from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cerifam consumption from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of children 6-59 months of age ever consuming Cerifam from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in caregivers' willingness to purchase Cerifam from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of households willing to purchase a 50g packet or Cerifam from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in caregivers' willingness to pay 12 Birr for Cerifam from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of households willing to pay 12 Ethiopian Birr for a 50g packet or Cerifam from baseline to end-line in the two study arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in caregivers' willingness to pay for Cerifam from baseline to end-line
secondary_outcome.description: Change in willingness to pay for Cerifam, using for example the change in mean maximum price that caregivers would be willing to pay for Cerifam from baseline to endline between the two study arms.

arm_group.description: Promotion of two main products: 1) Cerifam, a fortified complementary food popular in Ethiopia, and 2) eggs.

intervention.description: The study promoted two main products: 1) Cerifam, a fortified complementary food popular in Ethiopia, and 2) eggs. GAIN supported Faffa Food to redesign and label their Cerifam product, developed a manual for the manufacturing of complementary food and trained processors and regulators, provided Faffa Food with technical expertise to develop a business model, and financially and technically support the Ethiopian Standard Agency to develop a national standard for formulated complementary foods. GAIN provided training to egg farmers to increase their egg production and marketing, helped increase mother's access to eggs by making them more available in local kiosks and getting retailers to display promotional messages around eggs, conducted sensitization workshops with retailers to increase egg purchases, and employed a demand creation campaign.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Living in the project areas
- Caregiver 18 years old or above
Exclusion Criteria:
- households without children between the ages of 6-59 months

facility.name: Deep Dive Research and Consulting PLC

patient_data.ipd_description: Reports will be made available. We will provide information on how to make the request to have access to the partial or complete anonymized dataset.
